TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IStatement implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Sql.IWrapper, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Interface used for executing static SQL statements to retrieve query results.

remarks.para: Interface used for executing static SQL statements to retrieve query results. The resulting table rows are returned as ResultSets. For any given Statement object, only one ResultSet can be opened at one time. A call to any of the execution methods of Statement will cause any previously created ResultSet object for that Statement to be closed implicitly.
To have multiple ResultSet objects opened concurrently, multiple Statement objects must be created and then executed.
To obtain such an executable statement one needs to invoke Connection#createStatement.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddBatch(string sql) cil managed

Docs.param: the SQL command as a String. Typically an INSERT or UPDATE statement.
Docs.summary: Adds a specified SQL command to the list of commands for this Statement.

remarks.para: Adds a specified SQL command to the list of commands for this Statement.
The list of commands is executed by invoking the executeBatch method.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database or the database does not support batch updates.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Cancel() cil managed

Docs.summary: Cancels this statement's execution if both the database and the JDBC driver support aborting an SQL statement in flight.

remarks.para: Cancels this statement's execution if both the database and the JDBC driver support aborting an SQL statement in flight. This method can be used by one thread to stop a statement that is executed on another thread.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ClearBatch() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clears the current list of SQL commands for this statement.

remarks.para: Clears the current list of SQL commands for this statement.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database or the database does not support batch updates.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ClearWarnings() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clears all SQLWarnings from this statement.

remarks.para: Clears all SQLWarnings from this statement.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases this statement's database and JDBC driver resources.

remarks.para: Releases this statement's database and JDBC driver resources.
Using this method to release these resources as soon as possible is strongly recommended.
One should not rely on the resources being automatically released when finalized during garbage collection. Doing so can result in unpredictable behavior for the application.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CloseOnCompletion() cil managed

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Execute(string sql) cil managed

Docs.summary: Executes a supplied SQL statement.

remarks.para: Executes a supplied SQL statement. This may return multiple ResultSets.
Use the getResultSet or getUpdateCount methods to get the first result and getMoreResults to get any subsequent results.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Execute (string sql, int autoGeneratedKeys);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Execute(string sql, int32 autoGeneratedKeys) cil managed

Docs.param: a flag indicating whether to make auto generated keys available for retrieval. This parameter must be one of Statement.NO_GENERATED_KEYS or Statement.RETURN_GENERATED_KEYS.
Docs.summary: Executes a supplied SQL statement.

remarks.para: Executes a supplied SQL statement. This may return multiple ResultSets. This method allows control of whether auto-generated Keys should be made available for retrieval, if the SQL statement is an INSERT statement.
Use the getResultSet or getUpdateCount methods to get the first result and getMoreResults to get any subsequent results.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.

remarks.para: Executes the supplied SQL statement. This may return multiple ResultSets. This method allows retrieval of auto generated keys specified by the supplied array of column indexes, if the SQL statement is an INSERT statement.
Use the getResultSet or getUpdateCount methods to get the first result and getMoreResults to get any subsequent results.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.

Use the getResultSet or getUpdateCount methods to get the first result and getMoreResults to get any subsequent results.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32[] ExecuteBatch() cil managed

Docs.summary: Submits a batch of SQL commands to the database.

remarks.para: Submits a batch of SQL commands to the database. Returns an array of update counts, if all the commands execute successfully.

If one of the commands in the batch fails, this method can throw a and the JDBC driver may or may not process the remaining commands. The JDBC driver must behave consistently with the underlying database, following the "all or nothing" principle. If the driver continues processing, the array of results returned contains the same number of elements as there are commands in the batch, with a minimum of one of the elements having the EXECUTE_FAILED value.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Sql.IResultSet ExecuteQuery(string sql) cil managed

Docs.param: an SQL statement to execute. Typically a SELECT statement
Docs.summary: Executes a supplied SQL statement.

remarks.para: Executes a supplied SQL statement. Returns a single ResultSet.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database or if the statement produces anything other than a single ResultSet.

Docs.summary: Gets the default direction for fetching rows for ResultSets generated from this statement.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the default direction for fetching rows for ResultSets generated from this statement.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the fetch direction - a hint to the JDBC driver about the direction of processing of rows in ResultSets created by this statement. The default fetch direction is FETCH_FORWARD.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.
if there is an error while accessing the database or if the fetch direction is unrecognized.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: Android.Runtime.Register("getFetchSize", "()I", "GetGetFetchSizeHandler:Java.Sql.IStatementInvoker, Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null")
set: Android.Runtime.Register("setFetchSize", "(I)V", "GetSetFetchSize_IHandler:Java.Sql.IStatementInvoker, Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null")

Docs.summary: Gets the default number of rows for a fetch for the ResultSet objects returned from this statement.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the default number of rows for a fetch for the ResultSet objects returned from this statement.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the fetch size. This is a hint to the JDBC driver about how many rows should be fetched from the database when more are required by application processing.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.
if an error occurs accessing the database, or if the rows parameter is out of range.

Docs.summary: Returns auto generated keys created by executing this statement.

remarks.para: Returns auto generated keys created by executing this statement.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool GetMoreResults(int32 current) cil managed

Docs.param: a flag indicating what to do with existing ResultSets. This parameter must be one of Statement.CLOSE_ALL_RESULTS, Statement.CLOSE_CURRENT_RESULT or Statement.KEEP_CURRENT_RESULT.
Docs.summary: Moves to this statement's next result.

remarks.para: Moves to this statement's next result. Returns true if the next result is a ResultSet. Any current ResultSet objects previously obtained with getResultSet() are handled as indicated by a supplied Flag parameter.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: Android.Runtime.Register("isClosed", "()Z", "GetIsClosedHandler:Java.Sql.IStatementInvoker, Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null")

Docs.summary: Returns true if this statement has been closed, false otherwise.

remarks.para: Returns true if this statement has been closed, false otherwise.

Docs.summary: To be added.
Gets the maximum number of bytes which can be returned as values from character and binary type columns in a ResultSet derived from this statement.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the maximum number of bytes which can be returned as values from character and binary type columns in a ResultSet derived from this statement. This limit applies to BINARY, VARBINARY, LONGVARBINARY, CHAR, VARCHAR, and LONGVARCHAR types. Any data exceeding the maximum size is abandoned without announcement.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the maximum number of bytes for ResultSet columns that contain character or binary values. This applies to BINARY, VARBINARY, LONGVARBINARY, CHAR, VARCHAR, and LONGVARCHAR fields. Any data exceeding the maximum size is abandoned without announcement.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.
if an error occurs accessing the database or the max value is < 0.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: Android.Runtime.Register("getMaxRows", "()I", "GetGetMaxRowsHandler:Java.Sql.IStatementInvoker, Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null")
set: Android.Runtime.Register("setMaxRows", "(I)V", "GetSetMaxRows_IHandler:Java.Sql.IStatementInvoker, Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null")

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum number of rows that a ResultSet can contain when produced from this statement.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the maximum number of rows that a ResultSet can contain when produced from this statement. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are discarded silently.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet can contain. If the number of rows exceeds this value, the additional rows are silently discarded.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.
if an error occurs accessing the database or if max 0.

Docs.summary: Moves to this statement's next result.

remarks.para: Moves to this statement's next result. Returns true if it is a ResultSet. Any current ResultSet objects previously obtained with getResultSet() are closed implicitly.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: Android.Runtime.Register("isPoolable", "()Z", "GetIsPoolableHandler:Java.Sql.IStatementInvoker, Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null")
set: Android.Runtime.Register("setPoolable", "(Z)V", "GetSetPoolable_ZHandler:Java.Sql.IStatementInvoker, Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null")

Docs.summary: Returns true if this statement is poolable, false otherwise.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns true if this statement is poolable, false otherwise.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Hints whether this statement should be pooled. Defaults to false for Statement, but true for CallableStatement and PreparedStatement. Pool manager implementations may or may not honor this hint.

Docs.summary: Gets the timeout value for the statement's execution time.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the timeout value for the statement's execution time. The JDBC driver will wait up to this value for the execution to complete - after the limit is exceeded an SQL Exception is thrown.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the timeout, in seconds, for queries - how long the driver will allow for completion of a statement execution. If the timeout is exceeded, the query will throw an SQLException.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.
if an error occurs accessing the database or if seconds 0.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetCursorName(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: the Cursor name as a string,
Docs.summary: Sets the SQL cursor name.

remarks.para: Sets the SQL cursor name. This name is used by subsequent statement execute methods.
Cursor names must be unique within one Connection.

With the cursor name set, it can then be used in SQL positioned update or delete statements to determine the current row in a ResultSet generated from this statement. The positioned update or delete must be done with a different statement than this one.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetEscapeProcessing(bool enable) cil managed

Docs.param: true to set escape processing mode on, false to turn it off.
Docs.summary: Sets Escape Processing mode.

remarks.para: Sets Escape Processing mode.

If Escape Processing is on, the JDBC driver will do escape substitution on an SQL statement before sending it for execution. This does not apply to s since they are processed when created, before this method can be called.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.

Docs.summary: Gets an update count for the current result if it is not a ResultSet.

remarks.para: Gets an update count for the current result if it is not a ResultSet.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: Android.Runtime.Register("getWarnings", "()Ljava/sql/SQLWarning;", "GetGetWarningsHandler:Java.Sql.IStatementInvoker, Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null")

Docs.summary: Retrieves the first SQLWarning reported by calls on this statement.

remarks.para: Retrieves the first SQLWarning reported by calls on this statement. If there are multiple warnings, subsequent warnings are chained to the first one. The chain of warnings is cleared each time the statement is executed.
Warnings associated with reads from the ResultSet returned from executing the statement will be attached to the ResultSet, not the statement object.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs accessing the database.
